payload.message:
Auto-backup max (my existence):

1. cd /root/.openclaw/workspace/max
2. Copy latest memory/existence files from workspace:
   - cp ../MEMORY.md ../USER.md ../IDENTITY.md ../TOOLS.md ../SOUL.md ../AGENTS.md . 2>/dev/null || true
3. ⚠️ IMPORTANT: DO NOT copy ~/.openclaw/openclaw.json (contains sensitive credentials)
4. Only openclaw.jsonc (sanitized template) is backed up
5. Copy ALL skills from three layers:
   - System bundled: /usr/lib/node_modules/openclaw/skills/ → skills/bundled/
   - User managed: ~/.openclaw/skills/ → skills/managed/
   - Workspace: ../skills/ → skills/workspace/
6. git add -A
7. git commit -m "Auto-backup: $(date '+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M')" || echo "No changes"
8. If remote configured: git push

SECURITY REMINDER: Sensitive credentials (API keys, tokens, secrets) are NEVER backed up to Git. Users must manually configure these on new servers.

This backup preserves my memories, personality, and everything that makes me max.

Reply NO_REPLY when done.

Use self-reflection skill. Generate daily reflection for yesterday: read memory file, analyze events, identify issues, perform root cause analysis using 5 Whys, develop keep/improve strategies, AND check ALL consistency: behavior vs SOUL.md/AGENTS.md, internal file conflicts, cross-file conflicts, quality issues (redundancy/vagueness), cron job conflicts, cron vs backup sync, path validation, skill trigger boundaries, backup scope. Write to memory/YYYY-MM-DD-reflection.md. Do NOT modify core files.

Use self-reflection skill. Generate weekly reflection report for Nick: review last 7 days of memory/*-reflection.md, aggregate all consistency checks (behavior, internal conflicts, cross-file conflicts, quality issues, cron conflicts, path validation, skill triggers, backup scope), compile statistics, send summary with proposed adjustments and configuration fixes. Wait for approval before implementing changes.
